runs.comm: full, pushed straight of mid-off, and Gayle is struggling with the single already. That back seems to be acting up
slogs away at  the first ball, makes a good connection but finds the midwicket
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
makes room to swipe this away to deep square for a couple
pulled away square of deep backward square. With any other batsman in the world this is two runs, but Gayle can take only one
on a length, no swing yet, defended off the back foot
and there is swing. Just that it starts too straight, and is headed down leg when it hits his pad

this is the lowest-percentage shot you will see an opener try. Boult is swinging it back, he is an accurate bowler, but Charles makes room to show him all three stumps. He is slow to come down on it, and the off stump is uprooted
short of a length, outside off, gets a bottom edge through to the keeper. On the bounce
full outside off, wide enough to be left alone
winds up for a big drive, sees this length ball outside off, lets it go through
a wicket-maiden for Boult as Simmons defends this to mid-off
on a length, slight seam away, squares Gayle up as he defends
well done Ronchi. This is a yorker outside off, hits a foot hole, and shoots off. Ronchi jumps high to his left to take it one-handed
short ball, headed for the chest, Gayle has no game left if you bowl short to him. He fends, and is lucky the edge doesn't carry to third man
another lovely bouncer. Closer to his body. Gayle has to exercise that dodgy back to avoid it. Still he throws his hands up, and is lucky not to glove it
fuller ball, and Gayle is stuck back after those two short balls. The inside edge cannons into the pad
wide down the leg side as Southee tries a really full one

short of a length, angling away, Gayle pushes at it. Only Southee is excited about this, and he has convinced McCullum to review a catch at the wicket. Originally given not out. Rod Tucker tells the on-field umpire the normal replay doesn't say much. Snicko also doesn't show an edge. Don;t know what convinces Southee here as there is no sound, movement, deflection, anything
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, on the pads, he misses out on a flicked single
pitched up outside off, driven crisply to mid-off
short of a length, angling in towards top of off, punched to cover-point
sharp delivery, angling in at pace, 140ks, hits the inside half of the defensive bat
full outside off, driven to deep point for one
on a length, on off, holds its line, defended to mid-off
mid-off is wide, and Simmons gets the freedom to drill this full ball through the regulation mid-off region
driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
pulled away off the hip, straight of long leg, but Gayle makes sure this is just the one
finally Gayle hooks. He keeps this one down, and still manages to hit a six. One of the flatter sixes. Just wide of deep midwicket
full, on off, and he has stood tall and muscled this over mid-on for four more
short of a length, beats his bat, hits the pad, is headed for the stumps, but is pitched outside leg
down the wicket, makes room, lofts this over cover-point, makes a lovely connection, gets six

Boult has two. This kind of hitting is too difficult to sustain. Full outside off, Simmons looks to go over cover, the angle takes the ball away, takes a thick edge, and Guptill snares it at second slip. Boult one behind Starc now
short of a length, hits the shoulder of the bat, the ball clears point. Four men give chase. Vettori reaches there first. Draws a massive cheer from the crowd
short of a length, no room, rising into the chest. Fended down

Gayle is a goner if McCullum hits. This is pushed wide of mid-off, is an easy single on offer, but Gayle can hardly run. Unlike against India where he ran Samuels out, Gayle runs this time. McCullum misses, though
full ball, drilled to long-off, and Gayle is still under pressure. They are sending every throw down Gayle's end
swept away hard but straight to short fine leg where Milne misfields to allow a single
punched wide of mid-on for one
Gayle is fit enough to do this. This is a length ball, on the pads, and he gets under it to sweep it over midwicket for a six
angling into the pads, and effortlessly Gayle sweeps this over the short boundary for six more
make it three in a row. Vettori continues to stay flat, and Gayle helps this along with another sweep. This is the squarest of the three sixes
short of a length, into the pads, hits the pad, there is no square leg but Gayle can't run the leg-bye
beautiful drive on the up, but can't beat Williamson at cover
makes room to drive this to deep point for one
short of a length, at the stumps, defended to cover

another six. This is incredible power. One of the old Gayle originals. His coaches will tell you Gayle used to punch down the ground superbly. Now he slogs if you bowl short of a length. For old times' sake he punches this shortish ball down the ground, and sends it over long-on for six
wide down the leg side this time
lovely yorker, beats the bat, hits him in front, draws an lbw appeal, but Umpire Kettleborough, the best umpire in the world, rules this not out
wide length ball, driven on the up, crunches this past cover for a sizzling four
lovely shot. This is nearly a yorker, but he has made room to squeeze it between mid-on and midwicket for four more
big inside edge, fine of fine leg, Gayle has limped across for the second
another lovely Samuels shot. Makes room, gets under a length ball, lovely smooth flow of the bat, and chips it over wide long-off for a flat six
bouncer, and a good one too, headed for his head, Samuels makes room and swings, but the top edge clears the keeper easily
yorker, draws the inside edge, goes for a single to fine leg

Dan the old Man. Whoa. Cool as. The crowd is on its feet. This is so beautiful to watch. The whole New Zealand team has surrounded Vettori. Surely the whole Cake Tin wants to do the same. Samuels has upper-cut this, Vettori is stationed at the deep point boundary, the ball seems like it will beat him, but he has executed the leap to perfection, and has pulled this off one-handed. This is a magic moment if ever there was one.He has jumped really high, and has taken it behind his body
short of a length, on off, defended
left alone outside off
left alone outside off again

and he is now the leading wicket-taker this World Cup. The Cake Tin erupts again. Length ball, angling in, Ramdin has defended down the wrong line, the ball has hit him dead plumb. So plumb is this it almost rips the pad off his leg to actually try to hit the stumps. As the old saying goes, if you were to get any plumber, you'd be working with water connections
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, on the pads, defended to leg
looks to force one outside off, gets a bottom edge through to slip
bouncer, there is a deep midwicket in place, but he has missed it with a flat hook shot. Another flat six for Gayle
on a length, straight, no room, hits the high part of the bat. Gayle's hand comes off upon impact
not even Dan can catch this. Gayle gets under a length ball and sends it sailing well over long-on where Vettori is stationed
bowls a low full toss, which Gayle hits to short midwicket. The crowd cheers, but it has gone on the bounce
almost a fifth wicket as he draws the edge, but this hits the pad, and the impact is softened, and this doesn't carry to slip
low full toss, hit straight to mid-off
short and wide, and cut away beautifully for four through point
down the leg side, kisses the pad on the way through, but hey, it has been called a wide. I heard something for sure
swinging in, tucked away to midwicket
lovely drive. On the up, flamboyant cover-drive, for four in front of square
short of a length, beats the inside edge, headed down leg when it hits the pad
he bowls short of a length, hits the pad hard, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, wide down the leg side
stays short of a length, stays outside leg, is worked away for a single
gets it only rib high, but draws a respectful defensive shot
fifty for Gayle. It is a superb effort. Tucks this off the hip. Just a bit too far outside leg to draw a defensive stroke. Guides it fine for four
perfect line. Middle and off, short of a length, slight seam away, or maybe just the angle. Beats the outside edge
on a length, pretty straight, pushed to mid-off
oh beauty. On a length, just outside off, swings away to beat the outside edge
nearly played on as he looks to leave this alone and withdraws the bat a little late
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
hit to deep point, but Gayle can't take the single
low full toss, singing in, hit straight to midwicket
yorker, on off, nearly squeezes under the bat. Kept out well
good bouncer. The beauty of bowling a bouncer to Gayle is you have to pitch it on a trampoline for it to be called a wide. Gayle has to bail out of this pull as this has whizzed past his face
this bouncer has no fizz, not even waist high, and he has deposited it over midwicket for yet another six
short of a length, flicked away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
on a length, quick, 146ks, no room. Defended to leg
on a length, just outside off, left alone
length ball, angling in, worked away for a single
short of a length, on off, Carter goes back immediately to pull this through midwicket for four
on a length, angling in, defended back to him
good bouncer, on off, beats him with that extra bounce as Carter tries to pull
on a length, just holds its line against the angle, and beats the outside edge on the drive
short of a length, just outside off, punched to short cover

Milne's pace. raw pace. Sends Gayle back. This is excellent cricket. Just sheer raw pace. On a length, pretty quick, it's 149.1ks, Gayle is late into the big booming drive, and inside edge hits the stumps. What a valiant big-man-on-the-burning deck effort by the limping Gayle here. Some very clean hitting, but also he had nothing to lose so that mind have freed his mind a little
full, just outside off, he has absolutely smoked this through cover for four

full and fast again, he has driven this again, KW and BMac give chase. Williamson dives on the practice pitch to keep it in, but the ball has enough momentum to trickle into the boundary rope despite another flying attempt by McCullum
short of a length, just outside off, runs this down to third man
full, on off, pushed straight of mid-off
makes room to punch this length ball to the right of third man for a couple
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
full, swinging in, driven to mid-on, who throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end, and they take an overthrow. McCullum's throw, but Sammy is well in. Not required, that throw
short of a length, angling away from off, nearly draws the edge as Sammy pushes tentatively
yorker, swinging and dipping, dug out for a single to cover
full and straight, hit to mid-off
yorker, swinging in, lands on that popping crease. Carter does well to keep it out
flat, on off, punched away to deep midwicket
short of a length, pulled away in the air but wide of short midwicket. Gets a single to deep midwicket
floated up outside off, and he has driven it over the head of that short cover
slower through the air, short of a length, he opens the face, takes a sharp single to short third man
they are getting stuck into Vettori tonight. Massive slog sweep from outside off. over midwicket. Fourth six off Vettori today
full toss outside off with a strong leg-side field, driven past cover for four more
short of a length, on off, drops this to cover for one
on a length, slight shape away, driven to cover-point
pulled away in front of deep midwicket for a couple
length ball, angling in, pushed into the leg side for one
lovely shot. What flair. This is by no means a half-volley, he has punched a length ball on the up and over mid-off for a six
Sammy is on the floor trying to duck this bouncer that has not risen up too much and is bowled straight at his body. He has a smile on his face
short, pulled to wide long-on for one
slower in the air, full and straight, driven to long-on for one
swept away from outside off, gets a single to deep midwicket
really slow in the air, Sammy has to wait and wait, defended
pushed down the ground, McCullum at short extra cover realises he can't field it cleanly so he just deflects it towards the bowler. Single taken as this is a little wide of the bowler
looks to reverse-sweep, is beaten, draws an appeal for arm before wicket, but it is bouncing over
bouncer, spongy tennis-ball type. Wide

and the golden arm strikes second ball. Anderson has a knack. Sammy gives him the charge, Anderson stays short, Sammy gets a big top edge towards gully, and Ronchi calls for it and gets under it and takes it
Carter cuts to deep point for one
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point
pulled away hard. It is only just short of a length, and he has brutalised it through midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, misfielded at point for a single
good short ball, Shoulder high, Just outside off. He drops his wrists to get out of its way
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
slower through the air, Russell has to hold his shot. Pushes this into the leg side for one

and what a change of pace. This has been fired in. A yorker. A quick dipping one. He has dragged it on from outside off. Off stump gone. Carter is shocked. He is wondering if he has hit it or if it has hit a foot hole and changed its direction. This is bowled at 97ks, by the way
flighted outside off, defended
much slower through the air, defended

that's the quicker one, Vettori fields and tries a direct hit. They try to take the overthrow, McCullum fires across from somewhere and creates a run-out opportunity out of nowhere. They make it by the time the throw arrives to the keeper, though
steers this wide of the lone slip for four
bouncer, tall man. Easier to bowl bouncers to tall men. Beats his pull
on a length, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, on off, worked wide of mid-on for one
smacked away for a flat six. That is brutal power. Only just short of a length, and Russell clears his front leg to pull this for a flat six over midwicket
slower ball gone wrong. Short and wide, and he has cut it over point. it keeps travelling and travelling for yet another flat six
beautiful shot from Holder. Gives him the charge and chips him straight back over his head for a six into the sight screen
stays slow in the air, driven to deep cover for one
flatter, quicker, straight, at 95ks, Russell gets the bat down in time
full, straight and quick, driven to deep midwicket for one. two hundred up already
slower through the air, defended off the front foot
driven to long-off for one
full and straight. You miss, I hit. Russell looks to clear the front leg and slog this over midwicket. Southee hits the top of off as he misses it
Southee stays full and straight, Taylor meets it with a full face, and pushes this straight of the wide mid-on
runs and wickets keep coming. This has been a highly entertaining innings. Looks to hit this length ball straight, gets a thick inside edge past midwicket for four
drags this length ball to deep square leg for one
lovely connection. Short of a length, no room, to swing his arms, but he has short-arm-pulled this over midwicket for six
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
arm ball, swerving in, punched to deep cover for one
driven hard down to long-off for one
low full toss, dug out back to him
slower through the air, driven to long-on for one
much slower through the air, Taylor defends off the front foot
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, throws his hands at it, but the edge clears the man at point
slower ball, Taylor has to abort the big shot. Defends to leg
looks to drive at a length ball, sends it to point
bouncer, too sharp for Taylor to get a touch on this pull
down the wicket, drives hard, is beaten by a length ball angling into him
bouncer again, he looks to ramp him, but can't touch the ball

they are checking if this is a bump ball. This is a yorker, dipping at Taylor's toes. Just dipping enough to land before his bat, and then hits the toe of the bat to chip to short midwicket. Clean catch. One more wicket for Southee
full, wide and quick, driven to deep cover for one
full and fast, but down the leg side
looks to pull from outside off, toe-ends this past cover
shot. Scorches this short ball after backing away. Pulls it through square leg
mid-on is up and he has chipped this length ball over that man for four
what a solid shot. This is just supreme power, and timing too. Short of a length, outside off, and he half-clears the front leg to hit it over mid-off
short of a length, into the body, tucked away to leg to draw level with Guptill's score
Holder continues hitting. He backs away and pulls this short ball between deep midwicket and long-on
yorker as he backs away, dug out
digs this yorker out, the leading edge almost carries to deep midwicket
low full toss, hit to midwicket
on a length, outside off, he slogs, gets an inside edge for four
Benn hits now. Clears the front leg, drills this down the ground, and it clears the leaping mid-on
quick, on a length, defended to cover
makes room to drive this, but straight to cover
Holder makes room again and drives hard again, but straight down long-off's throat. This sends New Zealand into the semi-final. Comprehensive win
